result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew A Alden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to the Clerk of Courts Office- fine/cost to be taken out of forfeited money in 14CV119.
Must submit a DNA sample and pay $250.00 surcharge.
Cannot possess firearms or body armor.
Must complete or be in compliance with Mental Health regimen.

Cannot vote or hold public office. 
It not US Citizen, could be deported. 
Not to use illegal substances.

Defendant to be evaluated for Burnett County Drug Court program within 30 days. If accepted, successful completion of program is a term of probation. 
Defendant to keep yard clean.

timeConds.notes: Banked jail time to be used by agent if necessary.
Must complete 25 hours of Community Service per year while on probation for a total of 50 hours.

supervisions.notes: $265.60 fine/cost to the Clerk of Courts Office- to be paid out of forfeited money in 14CV119.

No alcohol. 
No illegal drugs or paraphernalia.
